snippet.title: How To Get Current Time in Java
snippet.description:
New course coming soon! Learn Java Fast launches on July 1st, 2020. Stay informed and join the waitlist: https://course.alexlorenlee.com/courses/learn-java-fast

- It's very easy to get the current time in java! ✅ Simply write this piece of code and format it with SimpleDateFormat()

Java date website: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

You don't have to calculate the time or anything yourself, this is how to get current date in java: Date d = new Date();

This way of calling the java current time can be a little tricky, but you'll get the hang of it! They aren't too bad :) If you followed along, congrats! You learned-by-doing!

💻 Source Code: https://github.com/alexlorenlee/JavaTutorialCode/blob/master/Other/CurrentDate.java

I hope you enjoyed this tutorial on how to get the java date and java time! I like to have a nice mix of tutorials and actual projects for you all :)

Do you want to learn how to code from scratch, in Java? Check out my Java Tutorial For Beginners: https://youtu.be/woJb2hAfkO0

How are you using the time in java? -

Free tips and programs: http://alexlorenlee.com

Recommended Channels to Subscribe to
